item.title: Cinderella: Andrew Lloyd Webber says theatre is on its knees due to Covid rules
item.description: The first two nights of his new West End show are cancelled due to Covid-19 self-isolation measures.

item.title: Sue Perkins announced as new host of Just A Minute
item.description: The comedian and broadcaster follows in the footsteps of the late Nicholas Parsons.

item.title: Space Jam: LeBron James sequel slam dunks Black Widow at box office
item.description: LeBron James' basketball sequel wins out as Marvel's blockbuster falters amid streaming tensions.

item.title: Ed Sheeran to give free concert to 700 fans in Coventry
item.description: The gig in August marks the "grand opening" of the HMV Empire which moved to a new site in Coventry.

item.title: Guto Harri quits GB News over taking the knee row
item.description: The journalist was suspended for a gesture made during a chat about the abuse of black footballers.

item.title: Strictly Come Dancing: Greatest Dancer winner joins professional dancer line-up
item.description: Poland's Jowita Przystal is one of four new additions to the BBC One's team of professional dancers.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Composer Keigo Oyamada resigns over bullying at school
item.description: Keigo Oyamada resigned after it came out that he bullied disabled classmates and boasted about it.

item.title: Sir Kenneth Branagh: The Browning Version cancelled due to Covid-enforced absences
item.description: The Browning Version was due to open in west London next month, with proceeds going to Rada.

item.title: Brands drop Chinese-Canadian star Kris Wu over sex allegations
item.description: Kris Wu denies allegations that he lured young girls, including minors, into having sex with him.

item.title: Stephen Fretwell: 'Gavin and Stacey song equated to a part-time job'
item.description: Stephen Fretwell on his hit TV show theme tune and why his 13-year music hiatus has come to an end.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival 2021 highlights: Sun, stars and saliva
item.description: A-listers flocked to the Cannes Film Festival's red carpet, despite the pandemic.

item.title: James Norton: Why making Nowhere Special made me sob and want children
item.description: The Grantchester actor on the emotional toll of playing a dying father and why he doesn't mind fame.

item.title: Elizabeth Gaskell: The Victorian author feeling the Bridgerton effect
item.description: Experts say the success of period dramas online has brought Elizabeth Gaskell a new audience.

item.title: The Broadway dancer whose lockdown business bloomed
item.description: When Covid closed New York theatres, dancer Robbie Fairchild started a business that put down roots.

item.title: David Bowie album artwork on sale in Shropshire auction
item.description: The collection belongs to artist Edward Bell who designed covers for the musician's records.

item.title: Photographer's shopping centre exhibition shows the authentic face of black Britain
item.description: Cephas Williams turns a shopping centre into a gallery for his Portrait of Black Britain exhibition.

item.title: England nightclubs reopen: Cheers and celebrations as clubbers return for first night out
item.description: For some revellers in Leeds, this was the first time they'd ever been to a nightclub.

item.title: Amy Winehouse documentary 10 years on from death shows 'more rounded image'
item.description: The late singer's father says he hopes a new documentary will show a "more rounded image" of Amy.

item.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories: Why Hollywood stars like Ryan Reynolds are lining up
item.description: Other stars to have taken part include Tom Hardy, Dolly Parton and Sir Elton John. Here's why.

item.title: Indiana Jones scenes filmed in Glasgow city centre
item.description: Filming is in full swing in Glasgow city centre for the new Indiana Jones movie.

item.title: Summer of Soul: New film revives lost Harlem Cultural Festival of 1969
item.description: A new film, the Summer of Soul, will explore the Harlem Cultural Festival and why it was forgotten.

item.title: Rashford mural artist: 'Incredible how people have come together'
item.description: Street artist Akse, who has repaired his Rashford mural, says local people have united to show their support.
